# Functions

In Rym it will be possible to define a function by using the _func_ keyword followed by a name for the function,
a comma separated list of parameters and their respective types as well as the return type of the function.

This means that a function will generally look like this:

```rym
func function_name(parameter_name: ParameterType) -> ReturnType {
  // function body
}
```

And a function with multiple parameters would look like this:

```rym
func function_name(p0: Type0, p1: Type1, pN: TypeN) -> ReturnType {
  // function body
}
```
